name: CORINE level 3
description: the Corine programme was initiated in the European Union. Corine means 'coordination of information on the environment' and it was a prototype project working on many different environmental issues. The Corine databases and several of its programmes have been taken over by the EEA. One of these is an inventory of land cover in 44 classes, and presented as a cartographic product

items.name: Continuous urban fabric
items.description: Most of the land is covered by . Buildings, roads and artificially surfaced area cover almost all the ground. Non-linear areas of vegetation and bare soil are exceptional

items.name: Discontinuous urban fabric
items.description: Most of the land is covered by structures. Buildings, roads and artificially surfaced areas associated with vegetated areas and bare soil, which occupy discontinuous but significant surfaces

items.name: Road and rail networks and associated land
items.description: Motorways, railways, including associated installations (stations, platforms, embankments). Minimum width to include: I 00 m

items.name: Industrial or commercial units
items.description: Artificially surfaced areas (with concrete, asphalt, tamacadam, or stabilised, e.g. beaten earth) devoid of vegetation, occupy most of the area in question, which also contains buildings and/or vegetated areas

items.name: Port areas
items.description: Infrastructure of port areas, including quays, dockyards and marinas.

items.name: Airports
items.description: Areas with open-pit extraction of industrial minerals (sandpits, quarries) or other minerals (opencast mines).Includes flooded gravel pits, except for river-bed extraction

items.name: Mineral extraction sites
items.description: Airport installations: runways, buildings and associated land.

items.name: Dump sites
items.description: Landfill or mine dump sites, industrial or public.

items.name: Construction sites
items.description: Camping grounds, sports grounds, leisure parks, golf courses, racecourses, etc. Includes formal parks not surrounded by urban zones.

items.name: Green urban areas
items.description: Areas with vegetation within urban fabric. Includes parks and cemeteries with vegetation.

items.name: Sport and leisure facilities
items.description: Camping grounds, sports grounds, leisure parks, golf courses, racecourses, etc. Includes formal parks not surrounded by urban zones.

items.name: Non-irrigated arable land
items.description: Cereals, legumes, fodder crops, root crops and fallow land. Includes flower and tree (nurseries) cultivation and vegetables, whether open field, under plastic or glass (includes market gardening). Includes aromatic, medicinal and culinary plants. Excludes permanent pastures.

items.name: Permanently irrigated land
items.description: Cereals, legumes, fodder crops, root crops and fallow land. Includes flower and tree (nurseries) cultivation and vegetables, whether open field, under plastic or glass (includes market gardening). Includes aromatic, medicinal and culinary plants. Excludes permanent pastures.

items.name: Rice fields
items.description: Land developed for rice cultivation. Flat surfaces with irrigation channels. Surfaces regularly flooded.

items.name: Vineyards
items.description: Areas planted with vines

items.name: Fruit trees and berry plantations
items.description: Parcels planted with fruit trees or shrubs: single or mixed fruit species, fruit trees associated with permanently grassed surfaces. Includes chestnut and walnut groves.

items.name: Olive Groves
items.description: Areas planted with olive trees, including mixed occurrence of olive trees and vines on the same parce

items.name: Pastures
items.description: Dense, predominantly graminoid grass cover, of floral composition, not under a rotation system. Mainly used for grazing, but the fodder may be harvested mechanically. Includes areas with hedges (bocage)e

items.name: Annual crops associated with permanent crops
items.description: Non-permanent crops (arable lands or pasture) associated with permanent crops on the same parcel

items.name: Complex cultivation
items.description: Juxtaposition of small parcels of diverse annual crops, pasture and/or permanent crops.

items.name: Mixed agriculure and natural vegetation
items.description: Areas principally occupied by agriculture, interspersed with significant natural areas

items.name: Agro-forestry areas
items.description: Annual crops or grazing land under the wooded cover of forestry species

items.name: Broad-leaved forest
items.description: Vegetation formation composed principally of trees, including shrub and bush understories, where broadleaved species predominate

items.name: Coniferous forest
items.description: Vegetation formation composed principally of trees, including shrub and bush understories, where coniferous species predominate

items.name: Mixed forest
items.description: Vegetation formation composed principally of trees, including shrub and bush understories, where broadleaved and coniferous species co~dominate

items.name: Natural grassland
items.description: Low productivity grassland. Often situated in areas of rough uneven ground. Frequently includes rocky areas, briars, and heathland.

items.name: Moors and heathland
items.description: Vegetation with low and closed cover, dominated by bushes, shrubs and herbaceous plants (heath, briars,broom, gorse, laburnum, etc.)

items.name: Sclerophyllous vegetation
items.description: Bushy sclerophyllous vegetation. Includes maquis and garrige.

items.name: Transitional woodland/shrub
items.description: Bushy or herbaceous vegetation with scattered trees. Can represent either woodland degradation or forest regeneration/colonisation

items.name: Beaches, dunes, and sand plains
items.description: Beaches, dunes and expanses of sand or pebbles in coastal or continental , including beds of stream channels with torrential regime

items.name: Bare rock
items.description: Scree, cliffs, rocks and outcrops

items.name: Sparsely vegetated areas
items.description: Includes steppes, tundra and badlands. Scattered high-attitude vegetation

items.name: Burnt areas
items.description: Areas affected by recent fires, still mainly black

items.name: Glaciers and perpetual snow
items.description: Land covered by glaciers or permanent snowfields

items.name: Inland marshes
items.description: Low-lying land usually flooded in winter, and more or less saturated by water all year round

items.name: Peatbogs
items.description: Peatland consisting mainly of decomposed moss and vegetable matter. May or may not be exploited

items.name: Salt marshes
items.description: Vegetated low-lying areas, above the high-tide line, susceptible to flooding by sea water. Often in the process of filling in, gradually being colonised by halophilic plants

items.name: Salines
items.description: Salt-pans, active or in process of . Sections of salt marsh exploited for the production of salt by evaporation. They are clearly distinguishable from the rest of the marsh by their segmentation and embankment systems

items.name: Water courses
items.description: Natural or artificial water-courses serving as water drainage channels. Includes canals. Minimum width to include: 100 m

items.name: Intertidal flats
items.description: Generally unvegetated expanses of mud, sand or rock lying between high and low water-marks. On contour on map

items.name: Water bodies
items.description: Natural or artificial stretches of water

items.name: Coastal lagoons
items.description: Unvegetated stretches of salt or brackish waters separated from the sea by a tongue of land or other similar topography. These water bodies can be connected with the sea at limited points, either permanently or for parts of the year only

items.name: Estuaries
items.description: The mouth of a river within which the tide ebbs and flows

items.name: Sea and ocean
items.description: Zone seaward of the lowest tide limit
